meanings.definition: The act of printing a publication in a single run.
meanings.sent1: During the pressrun, all the newspapers were printed at once.
meanings.sent2: The pressrun for the magazine was set for midnight.
meanings.sent3: The pressrun went smoothly until the printer ran out of ink!
meanings.sent4: The pressrun of the newspaper was like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The pressrun of the book was a flurry of activity in the printing room.

meanings.definition: A scheduled time for a printing press to produce a specific number of copies.
meanings.sent1: The pressrun for the flyers is at 3 PM today.
meanings.sent2: The pressrun for the brochures is delayed due to a technical issue.
meanings.sent3: The pressrun was so early that the printer had to wake up before sunrise!
meanings.sent4: The pressrun was like a race against time to meet the deadline.
meanings.sent5: The pressrun was crucial to ensure all the copies were ready for distribution.

meanings.definition: To print copies of a publication in a single run.
meanings.sent1: We need to pressrun the flyers before the event.
meanings.sent2: The printing company will pressrun the brochures tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally pressrun the wrong file and wasted paper.
meanings.sent4: She pressruns the newspapers with precision and speed.
meanings.sent5: Pressrunning the magazine efficiently requires a well-maintained printer.
